title: Stocks Rebound On Earnings Optimism
text:
Dollar weakening resumed

US stocks ended higher on Tuesday on positive corporate reports from major banks as the third quarter earnings season kicked off. The advanced 1% to 2995.68. gained 0.9% to 27024.80 led by 8.2% surge in UnitedHealth Group Incorporated (NYSE: ) shares. The rose 1.2% to 8148.71. The dollar weakening resumed: the live dollar index data show the ICE (NYSE: ) , a measure of the dollar’s strength against a basket of six rival currencies, lost 0.1% to 98.31 and is lower currently. Stock index futures point to higher openings today.

biggest winner among European indexes

European stocks resumed advancing on Tuesday after European Union indicated a Brexit deal with the UK is still possible this week. Both The and resumed their climb yesterday with Pound lower currently while euro higher still. The ended 1.0% higher led by retail and banking stocks. The German rose 1.2% to 12629.79. France’s advanced 1.1%. UK’s fell 1.8% to 7211.64 as UK rose by 22,000 in the three months to the end of August.

Australia’s All Ordinaries Index leads Asian indexes gains

Asian stock indices are mostly higher today despite IMF’s downgrade of the global growth forecast to 3%. rose 1.2% to 22472.92 as yen renewed its climb against the dollar. Chinese stocks are mixed after Beijing warned of retaliation if the three bills passed by the House on Tuesday supporting pro-democracy demonstrators in Hong Kong become law The Index is down 0.4% while Hong Kong’s is 0.5% higher. Australia’s extended gains 1.3% as Australian dollar continued sliding against the greenback.

AU200 D1 Chart

down

prices are still in free fall today. Prices fell yesterday on global demand decline concerns after the IMF on Tuesday forecast global economic growth falling to a 3% rate this year, the slowest pace since the 2008 financial crisis. December Brent lost 1% to $58.74 a barrel on Tuesday.
description: Stocks Analysis by IFC Markets covering: EUR/USD, GBP/USD, FTSE 100, S&P 500. Read IFC Markets's latest article on Investing.com
